TextBody:
Hello,
Can you please let me know what is your current on-premise EPP Server version and also the version of the server hosted by us ?
The first step is to make sure both server instances have the same version which is mandatory for the migration to work.
If needed, please upgrade the servers using the Live Updates feature until they have the same version. (as seen from the lower right corner of server UI).

Once the servers are on the same version you can create a System backup V2 on the old server. This will save all the settings and configurations. Make sure to save the password that is generated along with the System Backup V2 because it will be needed for the import. When the backup is complete, you can download it.
Then on the new appliance from System Maintenance > System Backup V2 we can import the backup previously created. Let us know when you reach this step, as we'll have to enable this feature from the backend for the server hosted by us.

Please note that the System Backup v2 will only save the settings and configuration from the old server, not the logs. You will find all the computers on the new server, all the rights and all the settings, except the logs. If you need the logs please create backups and download them before the migration (EPP UI > System Maintenance > Audit Log Backup).

The final migration step will be for you to redirect the existing epp agents to the new epp server IP/ domain and then shutdown the old server.
Let us know which OS you are using for client machines, as we can provide a tool to help you with this task.

Thank you and Best regards,
Alin

You will find all the computers on the new server, all the rights and all the settings, except the logs. If you need the logs please create backups and download them before the migration (EPP UI > System Maintenance > Audit Log Backup).

The final migration step will be for you to redirect the existing epp agents to the new epp server IP/ domain and then shutdown the old server.
Let us know which OS you are using for client machines, as we can provide a tool to help you with this task.

Thank you and Best regards,
Alin

The first step is to make sure both server instances have the same version which is mandatory for the migration to work.

Please note that the System Backup v2 will only save the settings and configuration from the old server, not the logs. You will find all the computers on the new server, all the rights and all the settings, except the logs. If you need the logs please create backups and download them before the migration (EPP UI > System Maintenance > Audit Log Backup).

The final migration step will be for you to redirect the existing epp agents to the new epp server IP/ domain and then shutdown the old server.
Let us know which OS you are using for client machines, as we can provide a tool to help you with this task.

Thank you and Best regards,
Alin
